content.question: A toy train moves along a straight track set up on a table. The position x(t) of the train at time t seconds is measured in centimeters from the center of the track. At time t = 1, the train is 6 centimeters to the left of the center, so x(1) = −6. For 0 ≤ t ≤ 4, the velocity of the train at time t is given by v(t) = 3t2 − 12, where v(t) is measured in centimeters per second. (a) For 0 ≤ t ≤ 4, find x(t).

frqParts.text: A toy train moves along a straight track set up on a table. The position x(t) of the train at time t seconds is measured in centimeters from the center of the track. At time t = 1, the train is 6 centimeters to the left of the center, so x(1) = −6. For 0 ≤ t ≤ 4, the velocity of the train at time t is given by v(t) = 3t2 − 12, where v(t) is measured in centimeters per second. (a) For 0 ≤ t ≤ 4, find x(t).

(b) Find the total distance traveled by the train during the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext> 4</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E55@</annotation> </semantics> </math> .

(c) A toy bus moving on the same table has position given by (x(t), y(t)). Here, x(t) is the function found in part (a), and y(t) = 2 + 12 sin(t/4) is the distance from the bus to the train track, in centimeters. Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression that gives the total distance traveled by the bus during the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 4.
